snippet: The Pentagon’s Africa Command, based in Germany, lacked a quick-response force to send to Libya when American diplomatic posts came under attack in Benghazi.
abstract: American officials describe previously undisclosed episode in which Pentagon issued urgent call for array of quick-reaction forces to respond to attack on American consulate in Benghazi, Libya; account underlines limitations of Pentagon's Africa Command, which is responsible for large swath of countries swept up in Arab Spring.

byline.original: By MICHAEL R. GORDON and ERIC SCHMITT

lead_paragraph: The Pentagon’s Africa Command, based in Germany, lacked a quick-response force to send to Libya when American diplomatic posts came under attack in Benghazi.

headline.seo: Benghazi Attack Raises Doubts About U.S. Abilities in Region
headline.main: Libya Attack Shows Pentagon’s Limits in Region
headline.print_headline: Libya Attack Shows Pentagon’s Limits in Region

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
